c74object.name: the.runtime
c74object.digest: Query runtime mode and application path
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Query the runtime mode of a patch or standalone application to further adapt file paths and preferences in the application accordingly. The path to the application as well as subfolders can be queried based on the current runtime mode.

objarg.name: autoquery
objarg.digest: Query and send runtime information on load
objarg.description:
Add any nonzero argument to query and send runtime information on load.
The default is 0 (disabled).

attribute.name: p
attribute.digest: Receive port to send path to
attribute.description: Provide an available receive port to send the patcher/application's path to.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.digest: Receive port to send runtime flag to
attribute.description: Provide an available receive port to send the runtime flag to.

attribute.name: c74sub
attribute.digest: Target specific subfolder of an application's Resources
attribute.description:
Target specific subfolder of an application's Resources (only for standalones). Instead of the actual application path, the word c74sub followed by a symbol representing a valid folder within the Resource-folder of the application will format the application path to accordingly point to this directory. Common desirable folders to scan or write to are media or data.
Hence, the attribute @c74sub media would yield the internal application's path to its 'media'-folder (…/[standalone]/Contents/C74/Resources/media/).

method.name: bang
method.description:
Get runtime flag and path.
leftmost outlet: path of patcher if runtime is 0
middle outlet: path of standalone if runtime is 1
rightmost outlet: runtime flag (0/1)
